page.title: 14Staploe Parish Social Club
page.content: Losing Eaton Socon to Cambridgeshire in 1965 left Staploe's scattered population with little social cohesion until the Silver Jubilee in 1977. A social club was started aimed at widening contacts and interests. A simple formula evolved to net all willing helpers. Questionnaires are circulated, asking each household if anyone will attend or help organise a number of suggested events, consider election to one of the three officer posts, or has any ideas worth putting into practice. Fund raising is not a primary aim but organizers budget to cover costs. Small surplusses finance childrens events. Whist, darts,Hallowe'en and Christmas parties are regular favourites but special effort is made to introduce new talks, visits, handicrafts or anything involving enough people to fund itself
